pages.text: This is a world controlled by EMC, and every action you take here will disrupt the balance of EMC in this world. $(br2)Therefore, when you disrupt the balance in this world, you will $(4)lose$() a certain amount of EMC, and when your EMC is not enough to cover the loss, it may have serious consequences. $(br2)As your abilities become stronger, the damage you do to the world's balance will become greater, and you will lose $(4)more$() EMC.

When you attack, take damage, die, pick up items, sleep, open containers, use a hoe, use a bucket, or craft items, you will consume EMC. $(br2)Your EMC value will be displayed in the upper left corner of the screen, and the number to the right of EMC is the $(4)death threshold$(), which is the EMC value below which all items will drop when you die. Conversely, consuming $(4)death threshold$() EMC ensures that items will not drop when you die. $(br2)Since EMCWorld version 0.4.0, the $(6)Energy Collector$() will not drop under any circumstances when the player dies.
